attires.name: Saree Blouse
attires.description: A fitted upper garment worn under a saree, often short-sleeved or sleeveless, and tailored to match the saree.

attires.name: Chudidar Top (Kameez)
attires.description: A long tunic worn with chudidar pants, popular among women in North India and Pakistan.

attires.name: Choli
attires.description: A midriff-baring blouse worn with ghagra or saree, often elaborately embroidered.

attires.name: Kurta
attires.description: A loose collarless shirt worn by both men and women, often paired with pyjama or churidar.

attires.name: Sherwani
attires.description: A long, coat-like garment worn by men, especially during weddings and formal occasions.

attires.name: Achkan
attires.description: A knee-length jacket worn by men, similar to a sherwani but lighter, often for formal occasions.

attires.name: Manipuri Phanek
attires.description: A traditional handwoven wrap skirt and upper garment worn by Meitei women in Manipur, often with bright stripes and intricate patterns.

attires.name: Naga Shawl
attires.description: A distinctive, handwoven shawl with bold patterns and colors, worn by Naga tribes as a symbol of status and identity.

attires.name: Assamese Mekhela Chador
attires.description: A two-piece traditional attire worn by Assamese women, consisting of a skirt-like lower garment (mekhela) and a draped upper cloth (chador).

attires.name: Khasi Jainsem
attires.description: A two-piece dress worn by Khasi women in Meghalaya, consisting of unstitched cloth draped over the body, often with a blouse underneath.

attires.name: Punjabi Patiala Suit
attires.description: A traditional Punjabi outfit consisting of a long tunic (kameez) paired with baggy trousers (patiala) and a dupatta.

attires.name: Bengali Panjabi
attires.description: A traditional Bengali outfit for men, typically a long tunic worn with pajama or dhoti, especially during festivals and ceremonies.

attires.name: Anarkali Suit
attires.description: A long, frock-style top paired with slim bottoms, popular for its elegant, flared silhouette among Indian women.

attires.name: Lehenga Choli
attires.description: A traditional three-piece outfit consisting of a long skirt (lehenga), a fitted blouse (choli), and a dupatta, worn at weddings and festivals.

attires.name: Salwar Kameez
attires.description: A comfortable and versatile outfit with a tunic top (kameez) and loose-fitting trousers (salwar), often paired with a dupatta.

attires.name: Dupatta
attires.description: A long scarf or shawl worn with various Indian outfits, draped over the shoulders or head for modesty and style.

attires.name: Banarasi Saree
attires.description: A luxurious silk saree from Varanasi, known for its rich brocade work and intricate gold or silver zari designs.

attires.name: Kanjeevaram Saree
attires.description: A traditional South Indian saree made from pure mulberry silk, famous for its vibrant colors and gold borders.

attires.name: Half Saree (Langa Voni)
attires.description: A three-piece traditional South Indian outfit for young women, consisting of a skirt, blouse, and draped dupatta.

attires.name: Crop Top with Skirt
attires.description: A modern fusion outfit featuring a short blouse (crop top) paired with a long, flowing skirt, popular at parties and weddings.
